image.altText: Three men at a table laughing

props.synopsis: Victoria's South Sudanese Community Association reforms after years of division.

title.children: This Victorian community was splintered by a civil war overseas. Now it's reforming for a fresh start

image.altText: A large group of people hold TWU banner saying 'Carrying Australia'

props.synopsis: The TWU says an internal investigation has forced the union to disband the Victorian-Tasmania branch, after it revealed significant issues and "unfounded" harassment allegations against its leadership.

title.children: Transport Workers' Union dissolves branch, claiming 'significant operational and cultural issues'

image.altText: Protesters walk along a street holding a massive sign that says 'CFMEU. Here to stay'.

props.synopsis: The former national president of the CFMEU launches a legal challenge to laws that force the construction union to accept an administrator, after allegations of criminal consorting, corruption and thuggery.

title.children: Former CFMEU heads launch high court challenge over forced administration

image.altText: Mad on left holds cupcakes while sitting next to another man and woman

props.synopsis: The post on the embassy's official Instagram account celebrated "Wear it Purple Day" and expressed dedication to creating "a supporting environment where everyone, especially LGBTQIA+ youth, can feel proud to be themselves".

title.children: Iran summons Australia's ambassador in Tehran over pro-LGBT Instagram post

image.altText: Woman with fair hair and man with grey hair stand together in formal clothes.

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds's lawyer tries to eviscerate Brittany Higgins's defamation defence by painting her as a deliberate liar who tried to ruin her former boss's career and bring down the Morrison government.

title.children: Linda Reynolds's lawyer attacks 'arrogant' Brittany Higgins for trivialising senator's hurt from the 'sanctity of France'

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of households are still without power as Victorians count the cost of wild storms that have lashed the state.

title.children: As destructive winds die down, Victoria is still dealing with the aftermath of violent storms

image.altText: Jaryd Clifford sinks to his knees and holds his head in his hands on the track

props.synopsis: While Jaryd Clifford was left heartbroken again, James Turner took his turn to celebrate a performance for the ages on the track on day six at the Paris Paralympics.

title.children: 'Almost so ridiculous it's funny': As Clifford curses his luck, Turner conquers the world

image.altText: White man taking a selfie in front of bricks wearing a black Lonsdale cap

props.synopsis: Sale man Matthew James Wain is sentenced to 10 years in prison for manslaughter after beating his flatmate and leaving him to die.

title.children: 'Violent, dangerous man' jailed for killing flatmate in Victoria's east

image.altText: James Turner crouches with an Australian flag next to a screen showing his world record time

props.synopsis: Madison de Rozario will race for another Paralympic medal in the women's 1,500m T54 final on day six in Paris. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: James Turner claims Paralympics gold and world record in 400m T36

image.altText: A swimming pool surrounded by plants in a city area, with tall buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's leading hospitality groups, Merivale, has been accused of fostering a culture that places women at risk, condones drug use by staff and patrons and fails to adequately address claims of sexual assault.

title.children: Hospitality group Merivale accused of fostering culture that places women at risk

image.altText: A koala facing towards the right of frame sits on a road, the koala fills the whole image and the background is only asphalt.

props.synopsis: We examined approved and proposed projects under federal environment legislation to look at how much koala habitat is being slated for destruction across several industries.

title.children: Thousands of hectares of koala habitat is cleared every year, including for renewable energy projects

image.altText: The words ‘No Change To WA GST’ have been scrawled on a reporter's arm and signed by Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: The GST deal has been described as "the worst public policy decision in Australia so far this century" but none of the major parties will touch it for fear of upsetting Western Australia.

title.children: The major parties are stuck in a $53b GST trap — because no-one dares anger the Vengeful Deity of the West

image.altText: a person pins a red awareness ribbon to their white shirt

props.synopsis: New numbers show HIV diagnoses have reduced by a third over the past decade despite a 2023 increase.

title.children: Australia ready for 'the end of AIDS' as HIV diagnoses continue to decrease

image.altText: Men walk down the road next to grey wall

props.synopsis: The terrorist group said the bombing was in response to Muslim prisoners being transferred to the "notorious 'Bagram' prison".

title.children: Islamic State group claims responsibility for deadly Kabul suicide bombing

image.altText: A police car parked near a beach, with the ocean visible in the distance.

props.synopsis: At least 12 people are dead after a boat carrying migrants capsized in the English Channel on its way to Britain, the French Interior Minister said on Tuesday, adding that two other people are missing.

title.children: At least 12 dead after migrant boat capsizes in English Channel

image.altText: a man looking sideways while standing outdoors speaking to the media

props.synopsis: The Liberal federal executive launched a takeover of the party's New South Wales division after 140 candidates for the upcoming local government elections failed to be nominated.

title.children: NSW Liberals forced into federal takeover after local election blunder

image.altText: A person wearing a keffiyeh holds their fingers up in a peace sign, a Palestinian flag is in the background.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Palestinian people apply for permanent protection as their tourist visas expire. Meanwhile the Coalition heaps pressure on the government after remarks made by ASIO boss Mike Burgess.

title.children: With expiring tourist visas, Palestinian people are applying for permanent protection in Australia

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenksyy speaks in front of a Ukrainian flag.

props.synopsis: The number of people killed has continued to rise since two ballistic missiles landed in the Ukrainian city of Poltava on Tuesday local time.

title.children: Russian missile strike on Ukrainian city kills at least 51 people, injures more than 200 others

image.altText: A woman in a wheelchair in parkland, with a baby strapped to her chest.

props.synopsis: Shelley Matheson says funding shortfalls have "decimated" her sport after returning to Australia's wheelchair basketball team following the birth of her second baby.

title.children: 'The women's program has been decimated': Paralympian calls for more support for wheelchair basketball

image.altText: A young man in a tropical shirt with

props.synopsis: Six months after he was kidnapped into Gaza with a grisly injury, 23-year-old Hersh Goldberg-Polin stunned everyone by appearing alive in a hostage video. His sudden death at the weekend has galvanised a nation.

title.children: After surviving almost 11 months of abuse, six hostages died in a Hamas tunnel

image.altText: The Star, formally known as Star City Casino, Sydney.

props.synopsis: Cash isn't the only thing in short supply at Star Entertainment. Time is also running out for newly installed chief executive Steve McCann to get a deal across the line.

title.children: Time is running out for Star Entertainment to secure a rescue package

image.altText: Two men walk past a military guard

props.synopsis: Living in Russia's shadow, Mongolia is not in a position to put President Vladimir Putin offside. But when he came to visit, the nation's obligations to the International Criminal Court were put into stark relief.

title.children: Vladimir Putin defied a war crimes arrest order to visit Mongolia. Here's what he might be up to

image.altText: The shadow of a young woman can be seen in front of the triple j sign

props.synopsis: Forced marriage is the most common form of human trafficking in Australia. We speak to a victim-survivor about how she escaped.

title.children: Aisha was engaged by the time she was 13. Within three years she'd taken her parents to court to escape a forced marriage

image.altText: A photo of NT Attorney-General Selena Uibo at the announcement of the Aboriginal Justice Agreement.

props.synopsis: Selena Uibo has been named the new leader of Territory Labor after the party's landslide defeat in the NT election. It makes her the first Indigenous woman to lead a major political party in Australian history.

title.children: New NT Opposition Leader Selena Uibo becomes first Indigenous woman to lead a major Australian party

image.altText: A child's hands plays with toys on wooden table

props.synopsis: A new workforce report has outlined the urgent need for more than 20,000 qualified early childhood education professionals across Australia.

title.children: Early childhood education workforce levels 'not sustainable', report finds

image.altText: Woman with tiger.

props.synopsis: An animal rescue organisation wants interactions between tigers and their handlers limited, as investigations continue into the mauling of an experienced worker at the Queensland theme park.

title.children: Dreamworld tiger attack prompts call for law change to protect animals and handlers

image.altText: Tim Bowden image

props.synopsis: Bowden discovered journalism as a teenager, sneaking into the back row of the theatre in 1950s Hobart to watch Cinesound newsreels, long before television was invented.

title.children: Former ABC broadcaster and author Tim Bowden dies, aged 87

image.altText: Skyscapers make up a very business end of town skyline

props.synopsis: As Australian mortgage holders wait for relief, the Reserve Bank of New Zealand cuts rates and green shoots emerge in the housing market.

title.children: 'The first cut is the deepest': NZ's central bank has cut rates and economists are singing a different tune

image.altText: A man stands beside the rootball of a tree with a diameter twice the height of him

props.synopsis: Tasmanians are working to repair damage from floods and high winds that hit the state over the past week, but the window of calm weather may be small with a new front expected to develop on Wednesday.

title.children: Reprieve in wild weather for Tasmania, as state works to repair damage from flooding and high winds

image.altText: Electronic gaming machines at a gambling venue

props.synopsis: Australians lead the world when it comes to gambling. But the only area of gaming and gambling where we appear to be lacking is in the area of legislation and oversight.

title.children: Why Australia is addicted to gambling

image.altText: Fire extinguisher tanks in a firefighters room.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has heard from more than a dozen people about allegations of a "macho hero" culture in Queensland's fire service.

title.children: 'Attractive' female firefighting recruits subjected to 'bell ringing' at Brisbane training academy

image.altText: Hands grasping a cyclone wire fence.

props.synopsis: The 15-year-old has been in state care since he was two days old. He has a "significant" disability but rarely received the care he needed, a magistrate says.

title.children: Indigenous boy imprisoned for two-thirds of this year may not have offended if he'd received proper care from state

image.altText: A farm property and distiller filled with floodwater

props.synopsis: Tasmanians are hoping for a reprieve from days of wind and heavy rain, as the state takes stock of the widespread damage. Follow live

title.children: Tasmanians mop up after flooding as wild weather eases across state

image.altText: A smaller boat next to a yacht in rough seas.

props.synopsis: A man and woman have been safely rescued from the stricken Spirit of Mateship yacht that is believed to be taking on water off the New South Wales south coast. A major joint operation was launched after a distress beacon was sent out yesterday.

title.children: Sydney to Hobart yacht abandoned off NSW coast after sailors rescued

image.altText: Gisele P walking into the courthouse with two cameras pointed at her.

props.synopsis: One of the 72-year-old woman's lawyers says she wants all the hearings to be public so that "events like these never happen again".

title.children: French man, 71, accused of drugging his wife, to allow strangers to rape her
